oai_dc:dc.dc:title: North Carolina land warrant, No. 94
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: North Carolina land warrant, No. 94, for 2,500 acres of land to George Doherty, dated September 4, 1785 and July 10, 1788. The land adjoins James Robertson’s. Includes seal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Land grants; Seals (Impressions)
North Carolina--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Land titles; United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: After the Revolutionary War, the federal government awarded bounty lands to citizens and soldiers for services rendered, often as the exchange of free land for military service.
